items.body: LEEP 9th GRADE STUDENT DEVELOPMENT PLAN
CLICK HERE TO ENTER THE JOURNEY
1.png

Welcome to LEEP’s 9th Grade Development Plans! Get ready for an awesome journey built just for you. We’ll give you the tools, skills, and a simple plan to help you reach your goals in school and in life. This is your first step toward making your dreams real, and we’re here to help you the whole way. Let’s get started and make it happen!
2.png

The development process starts with you! You know your interests, skills, and goals best. By understanding what's important to you, you can take control of your future and choose options that fit your priorities.
3.png

content.body: Your NorthStar Goal is the ULTIMATE GOAL you want to accomplish by the end of high school.

items.body: “Current Grade” NorthStar Goal (Short-Term)
This goal is all about staying on track and doing your best in your current grade. It focuses on your schoolwork, personal growth, and activities that will help you succeed this year.
“Graduation” NorthStar Goal (Long-Term)
This is your big dream for when you finish school. It’s the goal you're aiming for, with steps you take now and later to help you reach it and succeed.

content.body: Once you set your goals, think about the steps that will help you get there. These steps could be going to a LEEP workshop, studying on your own, doing special projects, or completing assignments that help you grow.
CLICK TO MOVE FORWARD ON YOUR JOURNEY

What challenges could I face trying to achieve this milestone goal and how can I overcome them?
How do I plan to track my progress during this milestone?
What tasks do I need to finish? Do I have a clear plan and timeline to reach my goals?
Who can give me helpful advice, and how do I use that advice to improve?

items.body: MILESTONE 1: THE GOAL AND PURPOSE
Establish meaningful, achievable goals for 9th Grade that will assist me with current and future success.

col-2.css: col-lg-6 col-md-12 p-3 border border-primary rounded-3

items.body: This month, we’re going to focus on setting your big “NorthStar Goal.” As you work toward your first milestone, you’ll create smaller goals to help you along the way. Here’s your first step to reaching that next milestone!

content.body: CLICK TO MOVE FORWARD ON YOUR JOURNEY
content.css: btn btn-link text-primary fw-semibold d-block mx-auto mt-3

items.body: 8.png
Create a Personal Core Value Statement
Create a Personal Mission Statement

col-1.css: col-lg-6 col-md-12 p-3 border border-primary rounded-3

items.body: PERSONAL CORE VALUE STATEMENT

A Personal Core Value is something that really matters to you. It’s like a personal guide that shapes how you act, make choices, and treat others. For example, if honesty is one of your values, telling the truth is important to you, and you’ll try to be truthful in everything you do. Values help define who you are and who you want to become.
THINK ABOUT WHAT MATTERS MOST TO YOU
What are the things that help you make decisions and act?

items: What qualities do you admire in other people?
What beliefs or ideas are most important to you?
When do you feel happiest and proud of yourself?

items.body: Now, write down 10-15 values that really matter to you, like honesty, kindness, or creativity. Then, narrow it down to your top 5 core values – these are the ones that guide what you do every day!

content.body: Create a Personal Core Value Statement
content.css: btn btn-link text-primary fw-semibold d-block mx-auto mt-3

items: Respect - Treating others kindly and valuing their differences
Accountability - Taking responsibility for your actions
Kindness - Being friendly, generous, and considerate to others
Compassion - Wanting to help those who are struggling
Optimism - Looking at situations with a positive outlook
Integrity - Doing the right thing, even when no one is watching
Honesty - Being truthful with yourself and others
Open-Mindedness - Being willing to consider new ideas and perspectives
Justice - Standing up for fairness and doing what's right
Growth - Always aiming to improve and learn
Responsibility - Owning your actions and choices
Creativity - Using imagination to think of new ideas
Patience - Staying calm and persistent, even in challenging situations
Courage - Being brave enough to face fears or try new things
Focus - Concentrating on the task or goal at hand
Perseverance - Sticking with something, even when it’s tough
Gratitude - Appreciating what you have and showing thankfulness
Leadership - Inspiring others and setting a good example
Dedication - Putting in effort and commitment to reach goals
Loyalty - Standing by friends, family, and commitments
Empathy - Understanding and caring about how others feel
Self-Discipline - Staying focused on goals and resisting distractions
Resilience - Bouncing back from challenges or setbacks
Adaptability - Being flexible and open to change
Service - Helping others and contributing to your community
Curiosity - Being eager to learn and explore new things
Teamwork - Working well with others to achieve a common goal
Humility - Recognizing that there’s always something new to learn
Self-Respect - Valuing yourself and your abilities
Ambition - Having strong goals and dreams for the future

content.body: Create Your Personal Core Value Statement
content.css: btn btn-link text-primary fw-semibold d-block mx-auto mt-3

content.body: "My mission is to always be true to myself, stay curious, and be kind to others. I want to keep learning, follow my passions, and use my strengths to make a difference in the world, no matter how big or small." - QUEST
